item.title: John add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Drugs will turn you into your parents." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: John add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "I wrote a song about dental floss but did anyone's teeth get cleaner?" -- Frank Zappa

item.title: John add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Some scientists claim that hydrogen, because it is so plentiful, is the basic building block of the universe. I dispute that. I say there is more stupidity than hydrogen, and that is the basic building block of the universe." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: John add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Drop out of school before your mind rots from exposure to our mediocre educational system. Forget about the Senior Prom and go to the library and educate yourself if you've got any guts. Some of you like Pep rallies and plastic robots who tell you what to read." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: John add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Take the Kama Sutra. How many people died from the Kama Sutra as opposed to the Bible? Who wins?" -- Frank Zappa

item.title: John add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "There is no such thing as a dirty word. Nor is there a word so powerful, that it's going to send the listener to the lake of fire upon hearing it." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: John add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Communism doesn't work because people like to own stuff." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: John add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "The United States is a nation of laws, badly written and randomly enforced." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: John add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Music is the only religion that delivers the goods." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: John add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "If you end up with a boring miserable life because you listened to your mom, your dad, your teacher, your priest, or some guy on television telling you how to do your shit, then you deserve it." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: John add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: John add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "I would challenge you to a battle of wits, but I see you are unarmed!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: John add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The first thing we do, let's kill all the lawyers." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: John add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "The aim of life is to live, and to live means to be aware, joyously, drunkenly, serenely, divinely aware." -- Henry Miller

item.title: John add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "I have no money, no resources, no hopes. I am the happiest man alive." -- Henry Miller

item.title: John add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "There is no salvation in becoming adapted to a world which is crazy" -- Henry Miller

item.title: John add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Everybody says sex is obscene. The only true obscenity is war." -- Henry Miller

item.title: John add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "If there is to be any peace it will come through being, not having." -- Henry Miller

item.title: John add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "No one asks you to throw Mozart out of the window. Keep Mozart. Cherish him. Keep Moses too, and Buddha and Lao Tzu and Christ. Keep them in your heart. But make room for the others, the coming ones, the ones who are already scratching on the window-panes." -- Henry Miller

item.title: John add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "I have found God, but he is insufficient." -- Henry Miller

item.title: John add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "I'm a bit retarded, like most Americans." -- Henry Miller

item.title: John add a quote by Nikos Kazantzakis
item.description: "Life is trouble. Only death is not. To be alive is to undo your belt and *look* for trouble." -- Nikos Kazantzakis

item.title: John add a quote by Nikos Kazantzakis
item.description: "God changes his appearance every second. Blessed is the man who can recognize him in all his disguises." -- Nikos Kazantzakis

item.title: John add a quote by Nikos Kazantzakis
item.description: "This is true happiness: to have no ambition and to work like a horse as if you had every ambition. To live far from men, not to need them and yet to love them. To have the stars above, the land to your left and the sea to your right and to realize of a sudden that in your heart, life has accomplished its final miracle: it has become a fairy tale." -- Nikos Kazantzakis

item.title: John add a quote by Nikos Kazantzakis
item.description: "Happy is the man, I thought, who, before dying, has the good fortune to sail the Aegean sea." -- Nikos Kazantzakis

item.title: John add a quote by Nikos Kazantzakis
item.description: "Since we cannot change reality, let us change the eyes which see reality." -- Nikos Kazantzakis

item.title: John add a quote by Nikos Kazantzakis
item.description: "We come from a dark abyss, we end in a dark abyss, and we call the luminous interval life." -- Nikos Kazantzakis

item.title: John add a quote by George Gordon Byron
item.description: "I have great hopes that we shall love each other all our lives as much as if we had never married at all. " -- George Gordon Byron

item.title: John add a quote by George Gordon Byron (Lord Byron)
item.description: "Those who will not reason, are bigots, those who cannot, are fools, and those who dare not, are slaves." -- George Gordon Byron (Lord Byron)

item.title: John add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain
